Authors: Dong-Mei Wang, Sheng-Hua Wu, Yi-Jian Yao
Title:
Clarification of the concept for Ganoderma orbiforme with
morphological plasticity
Keywords:
Molecular identification, morphology, Polyporales, tropics
and subtropics
Abstract:
In a study of type and voucher collections of Ganoderma,
we found that six described species G. cupreum, G. densizonatum, G.
limushanense, G. mastoporum, G. orbiforme, G. subtornatum, and records
of G. fornicatum from Mainland China and Taiwan are very similar in
basidiocarp texture, pilear cuticle structure, context colour, pore
colour and basidiospore characteristics. Further, we sequenced the
complete nrDNA ITS and partial mt SSU rDNA regions of some of these
studied materials, and performed phylogenetic analyses based on the
sequence data. The ITS sequence analysis results showed that
single-nucleotide polymorphisms occur in the ITS1 and/or ITS2 regions at
inter- and intra-individual levels, but these sequences were grouped
together with those of G. cupreum, G. mastoporum and G. subfornicatum
retrieved from GenBank forming a monophyletic clade. The mt SSU rDNA
sequence analysis results revealed that those two sequences derived from
this study were clustered together with those of G. cupreum retrieved
from GenBank and also formed a monophyletic clade. Based on
morphological and molecular data, we conclude that these studied taxa
are conspecific. Among the names assigned to this species, G. fornicatum
given to Asian collections has nomenclatural priority over the others.
However, the type of G. fornicatum from Brazil is probably lost and a
modern description based on the type lacked. The identity of Asian
collections as G. fornicatum therefore cannot be confirmed. Based on our
study, it seems better to consider G. orbiforme as the earliest valid
name for current use.
